ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: American Society is fair toward Black people.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Black children will feel better about themselves if they go to a school with mostly White children.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Families who go to religious or spiritual services will be close and stay together.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Black slavery is important never to forget.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Relatives can help Black parents raise their children.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Religion is an important part of a person's life.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Racism and discrimination are the hardest things a Black child has to face.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: having large families can help many Black families survive life struggles.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: You should be proud to be Black.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: All races are equal.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: If you work hard then you can overcome barriers in life.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: A belief in a Higher Power or Spiritual Presence can help a person deal with tough life struggles.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Black children will learn more if they go to a mostly White school.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Knowing your African heritage is important for your survival.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Racism is real, and you have to understand it or it will hurt you.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: You are connected to a history that goes back to African royalty.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Too much talk about racism will keep you from reaching your goals in life.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: School should be required to teach all children about Black history.

How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Depending on religion/spirituality and a Higher Power or Spiritual Presence will help you live a good life.

How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Families who talk openly about religiosity/spirituality or a Higher Power/Spiritual Presence will help each other grow.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Teachers can help Black children grow by showing signs of Black culture in the classroom.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Only people who are blood-related to you should be called your ''family.''
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Getting a good education is still the best way for you to get ahead.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Don't forget who your people are because you may need them someday.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Spiritual battles that people fight are more important than the physical battles.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: You should know about Black history so that you will be a better person.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Train up a child in the way they should go, and they will not turn away from it.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: You have to work twice as hard as White people in order to get ahead in this world.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: White people make it hard for people to get ahead in this world.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Be proud of who you are.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Going to a Black school will help Black children feel better about themselves.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: You need to learn how to live in a White world and a Black world.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Never be ashamed of your color.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: White people have more opportunities than Black people.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: A Black child or teenager will be harassed just because they are Black.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: More job opportunities would be open to Black people if people were not racist.

How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Black children should be taught early that a Higher Power or Spiritual Presence can protect them from racial hatred.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Black people don't always have the same opportunities as White people.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Black children don't have to know about Africa in order to survive life in America.
How often did your parents or any of your caregivers say the following to you in the last 6 months: Racism is not as bad today as it used to be before the 1960s.
